column4: I'm having a problem on Dapper installing the nvidia drivers.  Logfile: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14799
can u pate your /etc/X11/xorg.conf at patebin pls
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14800 <-- autogenerated by nvidia's xconfig
load you xorg.conf file for editing, run 'sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf'
sure
in 'Section "Module"'
yeah
comment out 'Load "dri"' and 'Load "GLcore"
then thats ok
is that all that is required?
one more
in 'Section "Device"'
make sure 'Driver "nvidia"' is there instead of 'Driver "nv''
if thats of, then save and try reloading the xserver, crtl+alt+backspace
fingers crossed you see the nvidia logo
when you logout, there should be an option to save session
you can add programs to auto start in system>preferences>session
hey
what do you get when u do 'dpkg -l | grep linux-restricted' ?
what kernal ae you using ?
I have the appropriate restricted modules.  But I'm on dapper
ok
